attributes.action: No public employee to be paid more than the Prime Minister
attributes.additional_details:
Many senior public employees, in the BBC, NHS, local government etc are vastly overpaid. There is no good reason that any public employee should earn more than the Prime Minister. This needs to be enshrined in law.
Currently every council chief earns more than the PM. And the director of BBC radio is remunerated £455,000 pa of our money. Which is outrageous.
